008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013
014import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016
017/**
018 * Calculates eigenvalues and eigenvectors of square matrices of arbitrary size.
019 * Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order). A matrix may have
020 * complex eigenvalues but only real eigenvalues (and their associated
021 * eigenvectors) are considered. 
022 * Associated eigenvalues and eigenvectors share the same index (k = 0,...,N-1)
023 * but are not sorted in any particular order.
024 * Uses class {@link EigenDecomposition} of the
025 * Apache Commons Math (3) library.
026 * <br>
027 * Usage example (retrieving all eigenvalues and associated eigenvectors):
028 * <pre>
029 * double[][] A = {
030 *      { 5, 2, 0, 1 },
031 *      { 2, 5, 0, 7 },
032 *      { -3, 4, 6, 0 },
033 *      { 1, 2, 3, 4 }};
034 * 
035 * RealEigensolver solver = new EigensolverNxN(A);
036 * 
037 * double[] eigenvals = solver.getEigenvalues();
038 * for (int k = 0; k &lt; solver.getSize(); k++) {
039 *      double lambda = solver.getEigenvalue(k);
040 *      if (Double.isFinite(lambda)) {
041 *              double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(k);
042 *              ...
043 *      }
044 * }</pre>
045 * 
046 * @author WB
047 * @version 2021/11/25
048 */
049public class EigensolverNxN implements RealEigensolver {
050
051        private final int n;
052        private final EigenDecomposition ed;
053        private final double[] eVals;
054
055        /**
056         * Constructor, takes a NxN (square) matrix.
057         * @param A a NxN matrix
058         */
059        public EigensolverNxN(double[][] A) {
060                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
061                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix A must be square");
062                }
063                this.n = A.length;
064                this.ed = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
065                this.eVals = makeEigenvalues(ed);
066        }
067
068
069        /**
070         * Creates the vector of real eigenvalues,
071         * marking all non-real eigenvalues by {@code NaN}.
072         * @param ed
073         * @return
074         */
075        private double[] makeEigenvalues(EigenDecomposition ed) {
076                double[] re = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
077                double[] im = ed.getImagEigenvalues();
078                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
079                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(im[i])) {
080                                re[i] = Double.NaN;
081                        }
082                }
083                return re;
084        }
085
086        @Override
087        public int getSize() {
088                return n;
089        }
090        
091        @Override
092        public boolean isReal() {
093                return !ed.hasComplexEigenvalues();
094        }
095
096        @Override
097        public double[] getEigenvalues() {
098                return eVals;
099        }
100
101        @Override
102        public double getEigenvalue(int k) {
103                return eVals[k];
104        }
105        
106        @Override
107        public double[][] getEigenvectors() {
108                return ed.getV().getData();
109        }
110
111        @Override
112        public double[] getEigenvector(int k) {
113                return ed.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
114        }
115        
116        public EigenDecomposition getDecomposition() {
117                return this.ed;
118        }
119        
120        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
121        
122        /**
123         * @param args args
124         * @hidden
125         */
126        public static void main(String[] args) {
127//              double[][] A = {
128//                              {3, -2},
129//                              {-4, 1}};
130//              double[][] A = {        // no real eigenvalues
131//                              {0, -1},
132//                              {2, 0}};
133//              double[][] A = {        // no real eigenvalues
134//                              {4, -1},
135//                              {2, 4}};
136//              double[][] A = {
137//                              {5, 2, 0},
138//                              {2, 5, 0},
139//                              {-3, 4, 6}};
140                double[][] A = {        // 2 real eigenvalues
141                                {5, 2, 0, 1},
142                                {2, 5, 0, 7},
143                                {-3, 4, 6, 0},
144                                {1 , 2, 3, 4}};
145                
146                
147                System.out.println("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
148                EigensolverNxN solver = new EigensolverNxN(A);  
149                
150                System.out.println("re = " + Matrix.toString(solver.getDecomposition().getRealEigenvalues()));
151                System.out.println("im = " + Matrix.toString(solver.getDecomposition().getImagEigenvalues()));
152
153                System.out.println("isReal = " + solver.isReal());
154                double[] eigenvals = solver.getEigenvalues();
155                System.out.println("evals = " + Matrix.toString(eigenvals));
156                System.out.println("evecs = \n" + Matrix.toString(solver.getEigenvectors()));
157                for (int k = 0; k < solver.getSize(); k++) {
158                        double lambda = solver.getEigenvalue(k);
159                        if (Double.isFinite(lambda)) {
160                                double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(k);
161                                System.out.println();
162                                System.out.format("λ_%d = %.6f\n", k, lambda);
163                                System.out.format("x_%d = %s\n", k, Matrix.toString(x));
164                                System.out.format("   M*x = %s\n", Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(A, x)));
165                                System.out.format("   λ*M = %s\n", Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(lambda, x)));
166                        }
167                }
168                
169        }
170
171
172}
